official-title.#text: To amend the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act to provide for an application process for interested parties to apply for a county to be designated as a rural area, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: CFPB Rural Designation Petition and Correction Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1022 of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:1022

header.#text: Designation of county as a rural area
Designation of county as a rural area

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall establish an application process under which a person who lives or does business in a State may, with respect to a county in such State that has not been designated by the
as a rural area for purposes of a Federal consumer financial law, apply for such county to be so designated.

text.#text: Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this subsection, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:1022/ss:e/p:1

text.#text: When evaluating an application submitted under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: s for classifying geographical areas as rural or urban.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of the Bureau of the Censu

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to designate counties as metropolitan or micropolitan or neither.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Director of the Office of Management and Budget

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to determine property eligibility for rural development programs.
rural-urban commuting area codes.

text.#text: A written opinion provided by the State’s banking regulator.
publish such application in the Federal Register; and
make such application available for public comment for not fewer than 90 days.
